meanings.definition: Control or supervise by means of rules and regulations.
meanings.sent1: The teacher needs to regulate the classroom to ensure everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent2: It is important to regulate traffic to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent3: Trying to regulate a group of toddlers is like herding cats.
meanings.sent4: She tried to regulate her emotions, but they spilled out uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The thermostat helps regulate the temperature in the house.

meanings.definition: Adjust or maintain the rate or level of something.
meanings.sent1: You can regulate the volume of the music by turning the knob.
meanings.sent2: Farmers need to regulate the amount of water their crops receive.
meanings.sent3: He tried to regulate his sleep schedule, but Netflix kept him up all night.
meanings.sent4: She regulated her breathing to calm her nerves before the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The governor had to regulate the speed at which the new law was implemented.

meanings.definition: Bring into conformity with a standard or requirement.
meanings.sent1: The company must regulate its practices to meet industry standards.
meanings.sent2: It's important to regulate the quality of products before they are sold.
meanings.sent3: Trying to regulate his messy desk was a lost cause.
meanings.sent4: She regulated her study habits to improve her grades.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to regulate the taste of the dish to match the recipe.
